page.title: 01ST.ALLEN AREA, NEAR TRURO.
page.content: This block,north of the City of Truro is mainly farmland,with sheep,beef, arable & dairyfarms,& some Forestry Commission woodland.St.Allen Church & former vicarage are central.Cornish names are prevalent.Farm sizes vary: Killivose,650 acres,is exceptionally big for this area;most are 130-250 acres;with a few small farms,small_ holdings & workers cottages.The A30 trunkroad crosses the N.W.corner for 1 km.;the A3076 Truro_Newquay road crosses the S.E.corner;Shortlanesend village amenities are just south of the block.Other roads are minor,well_ maintained country lanes edged by Cornish hedges,plant_covered banks of soil & stoneblocks.3 streams flow S.in wooded valleys to small River Allen. The area is popular with Truro people for walks along country lanes and woodland paths.
